original:
Gerontology is the comprehensive study of the social, cultural, psychological, cognitive, and biological aspects of aging. The term was first coined by Ilya Ilyich Mechnikov in 1903, deriving from the Greek words γέρων (gérōn), meaning "old man," and -λογία (-logía), meaning "study of." 

Gerontology is distinct from geriatrics, which focuses specifically on the medical treatment of diseases in older adults. Professionals in gerontology

Gerontology represents distinct from geriatrics, which focuses specifically around this medical treatment of diseases in older adults. Professionals in gerontology
